Bend Fire & Rescue drive-through event offers back to school supplies!

Families can drive through at the North Fire Station, 63377 Jamison Street, September 5th, 10 a.m. to 1 p.m.
Post Date: 09/01/2021 8:35 AM 

 

On Sunday, September 5, starting at 10 a.m. until 1 p.m., Bend Fire & Rescue will host a back-to-school drive-through event. It will be held at the North Fire Station, 63377 Jamison Street. 

Crews will be handing out back-to-school bags that will have basic back-to-school supplies and fire safety handouts for the family. We will also have fire trucks set up for families to drive past as they get their bags. 

Welcome back to school, kids!  

 

Click here for more information [ https://www.bendoregon.gov/Home/Components/News/News/4733/?medium=email&source=govdelivery ]

files.name: Legal Briefs: Law Services & News from Your Library
files.title: Legal Briefs: Law Services & News from Your Library
files.subject: Legal Briefs: Law Services & News from Your Library
files.plain_text: Deschutes Public Library Houses the Deschutes County Law Library  Visit Our Legal Resources Page Landlord-Tenant Law Resources Federal and state stays on evictions during the pandemic are slowly being rescinded. To this effect, many Central Oregon renters are at risk of losing their housing and are confused about their options. Below are several resources that can help. At the federal level: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau has clear information about assistance for homeowners, landlords and renters. At the state level: Renters and landlords can find current articles and videos from the Oregon State Bar. Legal Aid Services of Oregon has the most up-to-date information for renters at OregonRentersRights.org. Renters can get common questions answered at the Community Alliance of Tenant’s hotline. Jefferson and Crook County residents will need to register with the site to use it. Justice Index Deschutes Public Library's popular Lawyer in the Library program is run by our local Access to Justice Committee. This committee was created by our local bar association and trial court and, like similar committees in communities across the U.S., strives to assess the gaps in our local justice system and fill them. At the National Level, The National Center for Access to Justice compiles data, research, and policy analysis to expose how the justice system fails to stand up for equal justice. Anyone can access that data and see how each state measures up through its Justice Index. See how Oregon compares and find data for reports and proposals. New Resource: Hein Online We've added a new digital resource to the legal collection: Hein Online. This resource is available both on our public computers and remotely, meaning you can log in from anywhere you have internet access and your library card. Hein Online gives you access to current and historic federal and state case law, statutes, session laws, legal journals and treatises, and much more. It’s useful for lawyers, self-represented litigants, and students. Request more information or training on this new resource, through our Book-a-Librarian service. Thanks for reading; please share with anyone else who you think would benefit from this information. If you have questions or suggestions about the law library, feel free to email jenniferp@deschuteslibrary.org, or ask for me next time you’re in the Downtown Bend Library. Deschutes Public Library | 507 NW Wall Street, Bend, OR 97701 Unsubscribe i7z7x0u9w6y3p7r3@co-labconsultancy.slack.com Update Profile | Constant Contact Data Notice Sent by newsletter@dpls.lib.or.us powered by Try email marketing for free today!

files.title: Kindness to Frontline Workers | Stakeholder Workshops | Register for Why Guides | FEMA Funding
files.subject: Kindness to Frontline Workers | Stakeholder Workshops | Register for Why Guides | FEMA Funding
files.plain_text:
To view this email online, paste this link into your browser:
https://t.e2ma.net/message/l8rydh/966v8kob





  Sept. 1, 2021                                                                                                                                                                                          

Kindness to All: Celebrating Oregon's Frontline Workers

As businesses adapt to evolving mandates and safety precautions related to COVID-19, frontline workers continue to show up and work under difficult circumstances. We’re hearing stories about frontline workers facing resistance to new mask mandates and other health and safety rules. This week, Travel Oregon developed messaging and social tiles (https://t.e2ma.net/click/l8rydh/966v8kob/lgqac4b) in response to those stories. The images are intended for partners and businesses to use on websites, social channels and newsletters. Images are linked above for download. You may also share them directly from our Instagram (https://t.e2ma.net/click/l8rydh/966v8kob/18qac4b).

In addition to encouraging our partners to spread the message of kindness, we talked to six business members of our community to hear how they’ve been managing. Read their stories here (https://t.e2ma.net/click/l8rydh/966v8kob/h1rac4b). 

If you have questions about how you can use our messaging and images, direct emails to industry@traveloregon.com (mailto:industry@traveloregon.com). 

Co-Create the Future of Oregon Tourism: Stakeholder Workshops

Travel Oregon and international tourism experts, Destination Think!, invite you to participate in one of seven regional, virtual workshops in October:

Willamette Valley | Oct. 4, 1-3:45 p.m. | Register (https://t.e2ma.net/click/l8rydh/966v8kob/xtsac4b)

Mt. Hood & The Columbia River Gorge | Oct. 7, 2-4:45 p.m. | Register (https://t.e2ma.net/click/l8rydh/966v8kob/dmtac4b)

Portland Region | Oct. 8, 9-11:45 a.m. | Register (https://t.e2ma.net/click/l8rydh/966v8kob/teuac4b)

Eastern Oregon | Oct. 12, 9-11:45 a.m. | Register (https://t.e2ma.net/click/l8rydh/966v8kob/96uac4b)

Central Oregon | Oct. 13, 9-11:45 a.m. | Register (https://t.e2ma.net/click/l8rydh/966v8kob/pzvac4b)

Oregon Coast | Oct. 14, 9-11:45 a.m. | Register (https://t.e2ma.net/click/l8rydh/966v8kob/5rwac4b)

Southern Oregon | Oct. 15, 9-11:45 a.m. | Register (https://t.e2ma.net/click/l8rydh/966v8kob/lkxac4b)

The world is changing, agility to adapt to a quickly shifting tourism landscape is needed, and social justice and racial equity are at the forefront of our decisions. The chance to make transformational changes is necessary and now.

To seize this opportunity, Travel Oregon is undergoing a strategic planning process (https://t.e2ma.net/click/l8rydh/966v8kob/1cyac4b) to build a new, longer-term transformational vision and strategy – one that helps future-proof the industry and positions us to better manage and support Oregon’s lands and waters, our visitors, and one another. Your input during these workshops will have direct impact on Oregon’s tourism vision for the future, and how we work together with your region to achieve this vision in areas of resource allocation, product development, promotion and more.

Reminder: Register for Why Guides

Travel Oregon’s Why Guides program is an agency-wide effort to recognize and promote tourism industry operators, guides and outfitters as one of the state’s top tourism assets. This community of experts can help visitors navigate issues like fishing closures (https://t.e2ma.net/click/l8rydh/966v8kob/h5yac4b), ensuring a memorable and sustainable experience for visitors. If you are a tour guide, operator or outfitter, don’t forget to register (https://t.e2ma.net/click/l8rydh/966v8kob/xxzac4b) your business with Travel Oregon’s Why Guides program. Registration has been extended through December 2021. 

FEMA Public Assistance Funding for Emergency Support

Last week, FEMA released an update (https://t.e2ma.net/click/l8rydh/966v8kob/dq0ac4b) regarding emergency, major disaster and fire management assistance grant opportunities. FEMA is committed to providing state, local, tribal and territorial partners with support to manage disaster response and recovery efforts during the COVID-19 pandemic and the 2021 wildfire season. The following funding options are available to address challenges and manage response:

New Emergency, Major Disaster, and Fire Management Assistance Grant Declarations (https://t.e2ma.net/click/l8rydh/966v8kob/ti1ac4b)

COVID-19 Emergency and Major Disaster Declarations (https://t.e2ma.net/click/l8rydh/966v8kob/9a2ac4b)

COVID-19 Pandemic Operational Guidance (https://t.e2ma.net/click/l8rydh/966v8kob/p32ac4b)

Public Assistance Funding for Emergency Protective Measures (https://t.e2ma.net/click/l8rydh/966v8kob/5v3ac4b)

Additional information and contact information can be found here (https://t.e2ma.net/click/l8rydh/966v8kob/lo4ac4b).

Upcoming Events 

Oregon Heritage Grants Application Webinar (https://t.e2ma.net/click/l8rydh/966v8kob/1g5ac4b), Sept. 2

Oregon Heritage Grants Application Webinar (https://t.e2ma.net/click/l8rydh/966v8kob/h95ac4b), Sept. 9

Oregon Museums Association Virtual Conference (https://t.e2ma.net/click/l8rydh/966v8kob/x16ac4b), Sept. 13-15

Navigating the Healthcare Marketplace: Restaurant Owners (https://t.e2ma.net/click/l8rydh/966v8kob/du7ac4b), Sept. 13

Navigating the Healthcare Marketplace: Restaurant Workers (https://t.e2ma.net/click/l8rydh/966v8kob/tm8ac4b), Sept. 14

Greater Portland Athletic and Outdoor Virtual Tour (https://t.e2ma.net/click/l8rydh/966v8kob/9e9ac4b), Sept. 15

Oregon Hospitality Conference (https://t.e2ma.net/click/l8rydh/966v8kob/p79ac4b), Sept. 19-20

Oregon Tourism Commission Meeting (https://t.e2ma.net/click/l8rydh/966v8kob/5zabc4b), Oct. 5

Financial Literacy for Restaurant Workers (https://t.e2ma.net/click/l8rydh/966v8kob/lsbbc4b), Oct. 5

2021 Oregon Outdoor Recreation Summit (https://t.e2ma.net/click/l8rydh/966v8kob/1kcbc4b), Oct. 17-23

Upcoming Deadlines

Oregon Wine Country License Plates Matching Grants Applications (https://t.e2ma.net/click/l8rydh/966v8kob/hddbc4b), due Sept. 15

Rural Opportunity Initiative Grant Applications (https://t.e2ma.net/click/l8rydh/966v8kob/x5dbc4b), due Sept. 20

Oregon Heritage Grants Applications (https://t.e2ma.net/click/l8rydh/966v8kob/dyebc4b), due Oct. 20

Why Guides Registration (https://t.e2ma.net/click/l8rydh/966v8kob/tqfbc4b), extended through Dec. 2021

In-State Marketing Opportunity with KATU (https://t.e2ma.net/click/l8rydh/966v8kob/9igbc4b), due fall 2021

Research & Reports

Statewide Lodging Weekly Report (https://t.e2ma.net/click/l8rydh/966v8kob/pbhbc4b) (Aug. 22)

Sept. 1, 2021

Kindness to All: Celebrating Oregon's Frontline Workers

As businesses adapt to evolving mandates and safety precautions related to COVID-19, frontline workers continue to show up and work under difficult circumstances. We’re hearing stories about frontline workers facing resistance to new mask mandates and other health and safety rules. This week, Travel Oregon developed messaging and social tiles in response to those stories. The images are intended for partners and businesses to use on websites, social channels and newsletters. Images are linked above for download. You may also share them directly from our Instagram.

Emergency Homelessness Task Force Meeting #3 of 6

The joint-City/County Emergency Houselessness Task Force (EHTF) led by City of Bend - Councilor Perkins and Deschutes County - Commissioner Chang met for the third time on Tuesday, August 31. Watch a video replay...
Post Date: 09/01/2021 5:00 PM 

 

The joint-City/County Emergency Houselessness Task Force (EHTF) led by City of Bend - Councilor Perkins and Deschutes County - Commissioner Chang met for the third time on Tuesday, August 31 [ https://www.youtube.com/watch?medium=email&source=govdelivery&v=uMknDTAUxXM ]. 
The first three meetings covered stakeholder to scoping mappings. In the next three sessions, the plan is to go over gaps analysis, strategy development, and launch of the strategy discussion. 

The purpose of the Task Force is to bring the most informed minds on houselessness together to inform both the City and the County on collaborative opportunities with countywide resources and to develop actions toward ending houselessness in Deschutes County including interim actions to address real-time needs. There are also three subgroups within the EHTF with a specific focus on 1. Authorized Encampment, 2. Permanent Supportive Housing - Sustainable Funding Model Development, and 3. Emergency Protocol.

For more information about the EHTF and to watch a video replay, please visit City of Bend & Deschutes County Emergency Homelessness Task Force | City of Bend (bendoregon.gov) [ https://www.bendoregon.gov/government/committees/emergency-homelessness-task-force?medium=email&source=govdelivery ]. 

Click here for more information [ https://www.bendoregon.gov/Home/Components/News/News/4737/?medium=email&source=govdelivery ]

Emergency Homelessness Task Force - Meeting 3 of 6

The joint City/County Emergency Homelessness Task Force (EHTF) led by Councilor Perkins and Commissioner Chang met for the third time on Tuesday, August 31. Watch a replay of past meetings...
Post Date: 09/01/2021 6:30 PM 

The joint City/County Emergency Homelessness Task Force (EHTF) led by Councilor Perkins and Commissioner Chang met for the third time on Tuesday, August 31 [ https://www.youtube.com/watch?medium=email&source=govdelivery&v=uMknDTAUxXM ]. The first three meetings covered stakeholder to scoping mappings. For the next three, the plan is to go over gaps analysis, strategy development, and launch of the strategy discussion.

The purpose of the Task Force is to bring the most informed minds on houselessness together to inform both the City and the County on collaborative opportunities with countywide resources and to develop actions toward ending houselessness in Deschutes County including interim actions to address real-time needs. There are also three subgroups within the EHTF: 1. Authorized Encampment, 2. Permanent Supportive Housing Sustainable Funding, and 3. Emergency Protocol. 

For more information and to watch a video replay of past meetings, please visit https://www.bendoregon.gov/government/committees/emergency-homelessness-task-force [ https://www.bendoregon.gov/government/committees/emergency-homelessness-task-force?medium=email&source=govdelivery ]. 

Click here for more information [ https://www.bendoregon.gov/Home/Components/News/News/4741/?medium=email&source=govdelivery ]

City of Bend Celebrates Welcoming Week / La Ciudad de Bend celebra la Semana de Bienvenida

Sept. 10 to 19, 2021, del 10 al 19 de septiembre de 2021.

Information at www.bendoregon.gov/welcomingweek or in Spanish at www.bendoregon.gov/bienvenido. 
Post Date: 09/01/2021 7:45 PM 
City of Bend Celebrates Welcoming Week / La Ciudad de Bend celebra la Semana de Bienvenida

 

 

Tonight the Bend City Council declared Welcoming Week Sept. 10 to 19, 2021. 

Each year the City of Bend joins and supports numerous community partners in celebrating Welcoming Week, a series of community-organized events that highlight the principles of inclusion and create communities that prosper because everyone feels welcome. This year’s Welcoming Week theme is #BelongingBeginsWithUS supporting the narrative that each and every person in the community has the power to help others, regardless of their background, and each person has the right to feel like they are seen, embraced, welcomed and included.

Due to the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic, Welcoming Week this year will include both virtual and in-person events. All in-person events are encouraged to take place outdoors. All events must follow current state requirements for wearing masks indoors or outdoors. Festivities will begin with a virtual kick-off celebration from 6 p.m. to 7 p.m. on Friday, Sept. 10, hosted by the Latino Community Association.

Additional Welcoming Week events include Latino Fest, Advocacy Day Meet & Greet with City leadership, discussions on fair housing rights, uniting against racism, and fostering a welcoming business and community environment, a take-home Loteria game night with Bend Police Department, a back-to-school backpack distribution and more. 

View the Welcoming Week webpage [ https://www.bendoregon.gov/government/departments/city-manager-s-office/welcoming-bend?medium=email&source=govdelivery ] for a full list of events and information about how to participate.

In addition to attending Welcoming Week events, the City encourages all community members to participate on a social media. Participants can post a photo with an “I’m a Welcomer” sign to Facebook, Twitter or Instagram. Tag the City of Bend page and use the hashtags #IWelcome and #WelcomingWeek2021 to show support. There is also a “Bend Welcoming Week” photo frame available to add to Facebook profile photos and a Welcoming Week sticker to add to Instagram stories. Links to these items are also found on the Welcoming Week webpage.

Welcoming Week raises awareness about Bend’s status as a Welcoming City and the benefits of welcoming everyone, including immigrants and refugees. On June 21, 2017, the Bend City Council unanimously supported a resolution for the City of Bend to become a Welcoming City [ https://www.bendoregon.gov/home/showpublisheddocument/31912/636458327961930000 ]. Participation in Welcoming Week is one of the requirements for recognition as a Welcoming City.

For more information visit www.bendoregon.gov/welcomingweek [ ?medium=email&source=govdelivery%22http://www.bendoregon.gov/welcomingweek%22 ] or in Spanish at www.bendoregon.gov/bienvenido [ http://www.bendoregon.gov/bienvenido?medium=email&source=govdelivery ].  

 

  

 

La Ciudad de Bend celebra la Semana de Bienvenida

 

En la noche de hoy el Consejo Municipal de Bend declaró la Semana de Bienvenida del 10 al 19 de septiembre de 2021. 

Todos los años la Ciudad de Bend se une y apoya a muchos socios comunitarios en la celebración de la Semana de Bienvenida, una serie de eventos organizados por la comunidad que destacan los principios de inclusión y crean comunidades que prosperan porque todos se sienten bien recibidos. Este año el tema de la Semana de Bienvenida es ?medium=email&source=govdelivery#BelongingBeginsWithUS (la pertenencia empieza con nosotros), que apoya la narrativa de que cada integrante de la comunidad tiene el poder de ayudar a otros, sin importar sus antecedentes y orígenes, y que cada persona tiene el derecho de sentir que la tienen en cuenta, que es aceptada, bienvenida e incluida.

>
